page.title: 06ELDERLY PEOPLE'S HOUSING
page.content: In the area there are four groups of specialised accommodation for elderly people. These are situated in Picton Square, London Road, Hermitage Drive and Brookfield Drive. The Hermitage Flatlets were the first to be built by Congleton Borough Council. They were opened on 23 October 1961. The first tenants were in residence on 11 November 1961. There are 9 single flatlets, 3 double ones and 5 bungalows. All have a means of contact with the warden in an emergency or with a central control in Congleton when the warden is not on duty. Nevertheless, each unit provides an independent home. There are 18 tenants, 1 of whom lives with her son. There are 4 employees - the warden, a domestic lady, and home help who cooks meals, and a bath nurse. Dr. Hudson pays regular visits.
